description:
For each started VM, Hyper-V creates on the local disk a memory file for each VM. The memory file has the same size as the assigned VM memory. For example, if an instance with 4 GB ram starts, a 4 GB file is created.

This can cause scheduling issues, especially on hosts which have large quantities of memory, but  not a very large local disk, resulting in instances failing to spawn due to "insufficient local disk".
title: Hyper-V creates VM memory file on the local disk for each VM
